data.name: Nautical flag code
data.description: ## Here's the story An old man and his young grandson are deep sea fishing. A ship appears on the horizon, flying a series of flags. The color, shape and pattern of these flags correspond to an international code and can be decoded to spell out the ship's message. The old man's eyesight is no good at such a distance, so he gets the grandson to describe the flags to him. Since there is little time, and because the kid is young, the man asks for just the color(s) of each flag. What are the intentions of the approaching ship? If the ship is full of pirates, its flag message will surely contain one of the following words: 1. `"surrender"` 2. `"booty"` 3. `"plunder"` 4. `"argh"` (with any number of repeated letters, e.g. `"arrrrrggghh"`). If it's pirates, the boy should be told, `"Man the cannon!"` However, if the ship's message does not indicate piracy, the boy should be told, `"Keep fishin'."` ## Details Your function **flagCode** will take a string from the boy describing the color(s) of each flag, beginning with the first flag through the last. You should use the international flag code to determine if the sequence and color of the flags described by the boy correspond to any of the designated pirate words. The kid is waiting for instructions, so return the appropriate string once you've determined the threat level. ## Nautical Alphabet | Letter | Flag | Flag colors | |--------|------|-------------| | A | ![A](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/ICS_Alpha.svg/50px-ICS_Alpha.svg.png) | Blue, White | | B | ![B](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f7/ICS_Bravo.svg/50px-ICS_Bravo.svg.png) | Red | | C | ![C](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/ICS_Charlie.svg/50px-ICS_Charlie.svg.png) | Blue, Red, White | | D | ![D](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/eb/ICS_Delta.svg/50px-ICS_Delta.svg.png) | Blue, Yellow | | E | ![E](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0b/ICS_Echo.svg/50px-ICS_Echo.svg.png) | Blue, Red | | F | ![F](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/ICS_Foxtrot.svg/50px-ICS_Foxtrot.svg.png) | Red, White | | G | ![G](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fb/ICS_Golf.svg/50px-ICS_Golf.svg.png) | Blue, Yellow | | H | ![H](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0f/ICS_Hotel.svg/50px-ICS_Hotel.svg.png) | Red, White | | I | ![I](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8e/ICS_India.svg/50px-ICS_India.svg.png) | Black, Yellow | | J | ![J](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a0/ICS_Juliet.svg/50px-ICS_Juliet.svg.png) | Blue, White | | K | ![K](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/ICS_Kilo.svg/50px-ICS_Kilo.svg.png) | Blue, Yellow | | L | ![L](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/ICS_Lima.svg/50px-ICS_Lima.svg.png) | Black, Yellow | | M | ![M](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/73/ICS_Mike.svg/50px-ICS_Mike.svg.png) | Blue, White | | N | ![N](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/21/ICS_November.svg/50px-ICS_November.svg.png) | Blue, White | | O | ![O](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/ICS_Oscar.svg/50px-ICS_Oscar.svg.png) | Red, Yellow | | P | ![P](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d0/ICS_Papa.svg/50px-ICS_Papa.svg.png) | Blue, White | | Q | ![Q](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/ICS_Quebec.svg/50px-ICS_Quebec.svg.png) | Yellow | | R | ![R](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bf/ICS_Romeo.svg/50px-ICS_Romeo.svg.png) | Red, Yellow | | S | ![S](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/36/ICS_Sierra.svg/50px-ICS_Sierra.svg.png) | Blue, White | | T | ![T](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/ICS_Tango.svg/50px-ICS_Tango.svg.png) | Blue, Red, White | | U | ![U](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e2/ICS_Uniform.svg/50px-ICS_Uniform.svg.png) | Red, White | | V | ![V](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ef/ICS_Victor.svg/50px-ICS_Victor.svg.png) | Red, White | | W | ![W](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/ICS_Whiskey.svg/50px-ICS_Whiskey.svg.png) | Blue, Red, White | | X | ![X](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/ba/ICS_X-ray.svg/50px-ICS_X-ray.svg.png) | Blue, White | | Y | ![Y](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/ICS_Yankee.svg/50px-ICS_Yankee.svg.png) | Red, Yellow | | Z | ![Z](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/ICS_Zulu.svg/50px-ICS_Zulu.svg.png) | Black, Blue, Red, Yellow | For more information, see: #### Notes about flags - None of the flags will be "repeater" flags or numbers. - The boy will always include every color comprising each flag. For example, the "W" flag will always be described as "blue, white and red" (not necessarily in that order), and never as "blue and white," "red and white," "red," etc. - Some ships will have no flags: assume these ships to be safe. - **A pirate ship might be flying a "Jolly Roger" skull and crossbones flag**: any ship with a "black and white" flag should automatically be considered a pirate ship (no letter corresponds to a black and white flag). ## Example #1 This is the sort of information you're going to get from the kid (**look carefully**): `"The flag is blue and white and red next is red with blue next is blue with white and then blue with white then yellow with red and after that is white with blue and then comes white and blue next is red and yellow and after that is yellow with red and after that is red and yellow and then blue and yellow and then comes blue with yellow and then blue and yellow and after that is white and red."` It's a bit crude, but cut the kid some slack--he's very young and doing his best. You need to determine the possible letters for each flag: | # | | Flag colors | Possible letters | Pirate word | |---|--|-----------|------------------|---------------| | 1 |■■■|blue, red, white | c, t, w| | | 2 |■■|blue,red | e | | | 3 |■■|blue, white | a, j, m, n, p, s, x | | | 4 |■■ |blue, white | a, j, m, n, p, s, x | | | 5 |■■ |red, yellow | o, r, y | | | 6 |■■ |blue, white | **a**, j, m, n, p, s, x | a | | 7 |■■ |blue, white | **a**, j, m, n, p, s, x | a | | 8 |■■ |red, yellow | o, **r**, y| r | | 9 |■■ |red, yellow | o, **r**, y| r | |10 |■■ |red, yellow | o, **r**, y| r | |11 |■■ |blue, yellow | d, **g**, k| g | |12 |■■ |blue, yellow | d, **g**, k| g | |13 |■■ |blue, yellow | d, **g**, k| g| |14 |■■ |blue, yellow | d, **g**, k| g| |15 |■■ |red, white | f, **h**, u, v| h | Then you need to see if any designated pirate words can be spelled out using these flag colors. You don't need to determine the *actual* message, only that flags #6-15 can spell the word "aarrrggggh," which is a designated pirate word. Such a ship should be presumed dangerous. ## Example #2 Description: `"I see a flag that is blue and white and red and after that is black with white then comes blue with yellow and after that is red."` > after that is __black with white__ A black and white flag means pirates! **Good luck!**
